body_html:
@tatatodd
Operating System: ubuntu 14.04
CPU version, no cuda installed
I installed that from pip3
tensorflow version: 0.10, link: https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.10.0-cp34-cp34m-linux_x86_64.whl

reproductive sample is just as I mentioned before:

encoDecoCell = tf.nn.rnn_cell.BasicLSTMCell(hiddenSize, state_is_tuple=False)  # Or GRUCell, LSTMCell(hiddenSize)
#encoDecoCell = tf.nn.rnn_cell.DropoutWrapper(encoDecoCell, input_keep_prob=1.0, output_keep_prob=1.0)  # TODO: Custom values (WARNING: No dropout when testing !!!)
encoDecoCell = tf.nn.rnn_cell.MultiRNNCell([encoDecoCell] * numLayers, state_is_tuple=False)


encoderInputs  = [tf.placeholder(tf.int32,   [None, ]) for _ in range(maxLengthEnco)]  # Batch size * sequence length * input dim

decoderInputs  = [tf.placeholder(tf.int32,   [None, ], name='inputs') for _ in range(maxLengthDeco)]  # Same sentence length for input and output (Right ?)
decoderTargets = [tf.placeholder(tf.int32,   [None, ], name='targets') for _ in range(maxLengthDeco)]
decoderWeights = [tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [None, ], name='weights') for _ in range(maxLengthDeco)]

decoderOutputs, states = tf.nn.seq2seq.embedding_attention_seq2seq(
    self.encoderInputs,
    self.decoderInputs, 
    encoDecoCell,
    self.textData.getVocabularySize(),
    self.textData.getVocabularySize(),  
    embedding_size=self.args.embeddingSize, 
    output_projection=None, 
    feed_previous=bool(test)  
)

The first problem of AttributeError: 'LSTMStateTuple' object has no attribute 'get_shape'
will occur when I set state_is_tuple to true in the first and third line. When I set is to false, I have the second problem, as I mentioned above.
body_text:
@tatatodd
Operating System: ubuntu 14.04
CPU version, no cuda installed
I installed that from pip3
tensorflow version: 0.10, link: https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.10.0-cp34-cp34m-linux_x86_64.whl
reproductive sample is just as I mentioned before:
encoDecoCell = tf.nn.rnn_cell.BasicLSTMCell(hiddenSize, state_is_tuple=False)  # Or GRUCell, LSTMCell(hiddenSize)
#encoDecoCell = tf.nn.rnn_cell.DropoutWrapper(encoDecoCell, input_keep_prob=1.0, output_keep_prob=1.0)  # TODO: Custom values (WARNING: No dropout when testing !!!)
encoDecoCell = tf.nn.rnn_cell.MultiRNNCell([encoDecoCell] * numLayers, state_is_tuple=False)


encoderInputs  = [tf.placeholder(tf.int32,   [None, ]) for _ in range(maxLengthEnco)]  # Batch size * sequence length * input dim

decoderInputs  = [tf.placeholder(tf.int32,   [None, ], name='inputs') for _ in range(maxLengthDeco)]  # Same sentence length for input and output (Right ?)
decoderTargets = [tf.placeholder(tf.int32,   [None, ], name='targets') for _ in range(maxLengthDeco)]
decoderWeights = [tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [None, ], name='weights') for _ in range(maxLengthDeco)]

decoderOutputs, states = tf.nn.seq2seq.embedding_attention_seq2seq(
    self.encoderInputs,
    self.decoderInputs, 
    encoDecoCell,
    self.textData.getVocabularySize(),
    self.textData.getVocabularySize(),  
    embedding_size=self.args.embeddingSize, 
    output_projection=None, 
    feed_previous=bool(test)  
)



The first problem of AttributeError: 'LSTMStateTuple' object has no attribute 'get_shape'
will occur when I set state_is_tuple to true in the first and third line. When I set is to false, I have the second problem, as I mentioned above.
body:
@tatatodd 
Operating System: ubuntu 14.04
CPU version, no cuda installed
I installed that from pip3
tensorflow version: 0.10, link: https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.10.0-cp34-cp34m-linux_x86_64.whl

reproductive sample is just as I mentioned before:

```
encoDecoCell = tf.nn.rnn_cell.BasicLSTMCell(hiddenSize, state_is_tuple=False)  # Or GRUCell, LSTMCell(hiddenSize)
#encoDecoCell = tf.nn.rnn_cell.DropoutWrapper(encoDecoCell, input_keep_prob=1.0, output_keep_prob=1.0)  # TODO: Custom values (WARNING: No dropout when testing !!!)
encoDecoCell = tf.nn.rnn_cell.MultiRNNCell([encoDecoCell] * numLayers, state_is_tuple=False)


encoderInputs  = [tf.placeholder(tf.int32,   [None, ]) for _ in range(maxLengthEnco)]  # Batch size * sequence length * input dim

decoderInputs  = [tf.placeholder(tf.int32,   [None, ], name='inputs') for _ in range(maxLengthDeco)]  # Same sentence length for input and output (Right ?)
decoderTargets = [tf.placeholder(tf.int32,   [None, ], name='targets') for _ in range(maxLengthDeco)]
decoderWeights = [tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [None, ], name='weights') for _ in range(maxLengthDeco)]

decoderOutputs, states = tf.nn.seq2seq.embedding_attention_seq2seq(
    self.encoderInputs,
    self.decoderInputs, 
    encoDecoCell,
    self.textData.getVocabularySize(),
    self.textData.getVocabularySize(),  
    embedding_size=self.args.embeddingSize, 
    output_projection=None, 
    feed_previous=bool(test)  
)


```

The first problem of `AttributeError: 'LSTMStateTuple' object has no attribute 'get_shape'`
will occur when I set state_is_tuple to true in the first and third line. When I set is to false, I have the second problem, as I mentioned above.
